A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like: This movie is a mixed bag for me. It’s a enjoyable movie\, with a unique story in the SW universe and some good character arcs and moments\, but sometimes had problems with the pacing. It doesn’t really move much forward from where it started to where it ended and it’s definitely Not as good as Empire Strikes Back like a lot of people are saying. The message of failure overall was good\, the settings and shots were beautiful. My biggest problem with it was Luke’s characterization\, even though this is Mark Hamill’s best performance as him. Right form the moment when he picked Anakin’s lightsaber and then threw it away I knew\, without a doubt\, that this was not going to go the way I thought (but hey we were warned by Luke right in the trailers). Also\, the Finn and Rose story arc\, I didn’t hate it but I feel like John Boyega’s potencial was so wasted in this movie. What was the point of having Phasma so you could kill her right away? It was as bad as Boba Fett’s death. Some of the humor was not bad\, unexpected in a Star Wars movie\, but didn’t bother me that much. It seemed like everything JJ Abrams built to in TFA was thrown away so that Rian Johnson could put his own vision. It’s not a bad movie but the some of the choices the characters make\, specially Luke\, just seem out of place. Snoke’s death would’ve been so much better if instead of showing us what Kylo was really planning to do\, keep Snoke saying what Kylo was thinking but don’t show him moving the lightsaber. The movie still has some good moments like the Throne Room fight scene\, when Luke is teaching Rey about the force\, Yoda’s appearance\, Luke and Leia together\, when R2 shows Luke Leia’s message from the OT. Luke’s last scene where it mirrored the twin suns in Tattoine from Ep IV was my favorite. The best thing was that Poe got more screen time which is always a good thing. I admire Rian Johnson for trying to go in a different and fresh direction but sometimes the movie doesn’t feel like a Star Wars movie.
